lexUnit.name: surround.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be located on every side of.

sentence.text: The captured Dragoon shivered as the German cavalry surrounded him .
Inside the Glass House , heat surrounds us like wet felt .
Broken china surrounded her hands .
The Foreign Secretary opened his speech by referring to the monumental events that now surround us .
The throng of Masai surrounds them .
Shrouded in mystery : Fog surrounds a police tent covering the spot where James Bulger was found on Sunday
We watched several patrol cars surround the area without confronting the crowd .
Towering mountains surround the village and the area around St Anton is fantastic for walking .
Well that 's what I said why did n't they surround it a mile away .
That day they surrounded the farmhouse of the Baruffini family , where they found several prisoners .
At least a hundred thousand people surrounded the cathedral where the chiefs in all their finery were massed in serried ranks .
Still , if the UN forces are strengthened , the chances are that the Serbs will not overrun the enclaves they surround .
The second was the sight of strange mythological beasts and demonic gargoyles which surrounded and surmounted the gateway .
Accommodation is in two storey , thatched rondavel style buildings which surround an attractive pool area .
Consider the potential disagreements that surround the interpretation of various Cambrian fossils : are the pseudobrachiopods ` truly " brachiopods ?
The secrecy that surrounded Emor had been a large part of its charm .
A medical quality quartz tube surrounds the U/V tube which has a 5,000 hour continuous use life .
Hundreds of police surrounded the assembly to protect them .
Ageism surrounds us , but it passes largely unnoticed and unchallenged .
Rumours of other major changes surround the label .
The game in hand is always the most important and the euphoria that surrounded the result on 6 February is now a thing of the past .
